embed.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to put something firmly and deeply into something else, or to be put into something in this way
embed.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: A piece of glass was embedded in her hand.
embed.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: if ideas, attitudes, or feelings etc are embedded, you believe or feel them very strongly
embed.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Feelings of guilt are deeply embedded in her personality.
embed.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to put something such as a graphic  into a computer program or page on the Internet
embed.translation[0].note_box[0].items[0: Embed is usually passive when used as a transitive verb
embed.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: to put something such as an image, sound etc into a page on a Internet website or into a program, using computer codes
embed.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: This document shows you the right tags to use to embed sound onto your website.
